characters: WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU DOING
I'LL GUT YOU LIKE A FUCKING-
I'LL FUCKING CARVE YOU UP- HEAR ME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the flight deck it's ghostly vacant, rows of empty flight chairs and numerous guidance computers gently blinking. With half filled coffee-cups and jackets hung o the seat backs... it appears the control deck has been suddenly evacuated. Muffled SCREAMS are heard somewhere deeper inside the shi

dialogues.speaker: BOWER., (V.0.)
dialogues.text: As the entire world watched in wonder, there were only a few, skeptical of the journey's success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few... who would be right. The further we move into the ship... signs of violence appear, smears of dark blood sharply standing out on the bright white paneling and several broken computer screens The muffled SCREAMS grow louder and clearer... an argumen between men, panicked rage over-lapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA slowly moves past a corner to see the middle-of a violent confrontation. One OFFICER is locked inside a sle chamber, banging on the glass and pleading with panic. Another OFFICER is on the floor, mortally wounded, his bo still twitching with his head bashed in. The INSANE OFFIC a young corporal is moving from terminal to terminal, typ in commands with a casual and emotionless nature. Blood streams have run down his face from both ears and n as he continues to type commands into the flight computer heightening the trapped OFFICER'S muffled,. screams.

dialogues.speaker: GOD NO
dialogues.text: The INSANE OFFICER hits the final command key and warning buzzers ignite with flashing lights. He closes his eyes, taking a breath of relief.

dialogues.speaker: TO FUCKING KILL US ALL
dialogues.text: The trapped OFFICER begins pounding on the glass with a crazed panic as the INSANE OFFICER calmly goes to his own sleep-pod and climbs inside, sealing the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE GOD
dialogues.text: Control panels flash and hydraulics ignite. Like a row of tumbling dominos, each of the sleep-chamber pods shift positions with a SHUSH of hydraulics and then... they are launched with a ROAR of micro-jets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're suddenly back into the unsettling silence as... lik bee hive that's exploded, thousands of coffin-sized sleep pods are ejected from the ship in unison. They are sent tumbling into open space in every direction as the ship slowly continues its unaffected course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trapped OFFICER is seen SCREAMING in silence inside h own pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slowly float towards an astroid field. As we grow clos it's the sea of sleep pods slowly floating through space.

dialogues.speaker: BOWER, (P.O.)
dialogues.text: Where was I... when I heard we'd lost Eden? Just like every other kid on my block... I was dreaming... of being one who would be chosen to follow. As we move closer to the asteroid field of sleep pods, it obvious that time has passed, a single skeleton inside ea of the pods, hands in a clawing position towards the glas We PUSH IN towards one pod, moving towards the SKULL, sti locked in a SCREAMING position, wide mouthed and...

dialogues.speaker: M. HYPER-SLEEP CHAMBER
dialogues.text: A RUMBLE passes... EYELIDS TWITCH... A GASP. Inside a coffin-size chamber, a dim glow of light seeps through a small glass porthole. A MAN is asleep, a mask attached to his face, tubes of liquid feeding into his ar CORPORAL BOWER, military physique, chiseled features. His chest lightly expanding, blood pulsating through his vein Lights FLICKER PAST and his body comes to life, muscles flinching, breath quickening. He squirms with discomfort, ripping away the mask. He gasps, trying to SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His scream is muffled under three inches of glass. The ha door is hit with a THUD and white gases erupt from the ed THUD, THUD... THUD! The door bursts open and BOWER scampe out, struggling to rip away the feeding tubes. He HITS th floor, naked and gasping. His pores ignite, dripping swea He tries to get to his feet, but his legs wobble undernea him, collapsing. He yells at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burns are red! Bruises... blue- His voice echoes into the dark, alone in a cavernous room he pauses, struggling for orientation. He gets to his fee muscles twitching. His short-cropped hair is... pure whit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...? HEY!!? Someone? A constant low RUMBLE is present, joined by the occasiona MOAN and CREAK of a large ship. A SHUDDER travels through the room with a random FLICKER of LIGHTS to reveal... A massive steel compartment, tangled with technology. It' cold and institutional. High-tech computer terminals slop out of the floor. The FLICKER passes, taking us into blac We hear him: fumbling through the room, switches are thro with no result and compartments are pulled opened and... SNAP! A glow stick comes to life. He squints at his darkened surroundings with confusion. A drip of liquid catches his eye and he staggers back to hi sleep pod. He grabs the dangling tubes that were ripped f his arm and he sucks on the tube, pulling as much liquid his mouth as possible. After a few heavy gulps, he suddenly heaves towards the floor. He painfully forces himself to drink, gasping. He looks up to notice two sleep chambers next to his own. leans closer with the glow stick to see the first one, th name plate reading; 2nd Lt. Cooper. It's EMPTY. The third pod's name plate reads; LT. PAYTON. Deep inside there is the figure of a man, asleep under a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton? Lieutenant... Payton? He turns back to his own pod, seeing the name plate that reads; CORPORAL BOWER. Even this name doesn't seem famili

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower? Bower...? The loss of memory heightens his fear even more as a shiv travels through his body while he staggers towards a near computer terminal. He taps the keys on a computer termina Nothing. He frowns, leaning closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he taps the keyboard, powder blooms out from under his fingers. He wipes the surface of the panel to see a thick layer of dust. Under the smear is... Elysium - Flight Systems - Operation Terminal #87153-D. He pulls focus to see... his FINGERS are trembling uncontrollably, an odd vibration of nerves. He slowly mak a fist with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER walks along a row of storage lockers reading each n plate. He stops at the locker labelled; Corp. Bower. He pauses, mumbling the name once again with no recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower. He opens the locker to see an assortment of personalized belongings, uniform and gear, none of it seeming familiar He uses a towel to wipe off the layer of sweat and oily substance coating his body, pausing to see an identificat tattoo on his forearm that reads: FLT>>005Г‚В»015. He pulls on a black flight suit, emblems and military markings of rank on the chest. He pulls on shoes and a to belt with a high powered pen-lamp. On the inside of the locker is a emergency manual card wi block figures displaying breathing and stretching exercis labelled; Hyper-Sleep Disorientation Recovery Procedures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading to himself) .in the event of mild memory loss... resulting from extended- He freezes on... A PHOTO tucked inside the door. EVALON, beautiful young woman smiling towards camera. He stares a the-photo, his frown deepening with confusion. He checks back for a name, but nothing. He tucks the photo into a pocket and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER waves his hand over a sensor... no power. He steps front of a heavy set of steel doors, flipping several switches and... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER breaks open a storage bin, pulling out beverage pac and a cup, taking a seat at the control desk. With Evalon photograph leaned against the console, he becomes lost in gaze as he gulps down nutrient pills and stirs an instant coffee as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a conflict in his eyes, memories trying to retur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An image FLASHES past, EVALON smiling as BOWER kneels nex her, gripping her hands. BOWER'S gaze remains hollow, frown deepening as he sips t cup and... winces with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faa-uck! Distant THUMPS. He pans the pen-lamp across the ceiling a toward the sounds... PAYTON'S sleep chamber. THUMP, THUMP, THUMP: Muffled and desperate. CRACK! Bower jumps back as someone kicks their way out from inside, th hatch bursting open. Out climbs... PAYTON, a man in his forties, but the rugged physique of man half his age, lean and agile. His military-style hair cut is also pure white. Gasping for breath, he hits the floor as BOWER tries to help him. PAYTON jerks with shock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Hey... easy! Lt. Payton? You're- Sir... whoa! PAYTON chokes and gasps, then glances up, giving Bower a over with a frown and a sobering tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower. Corporal... Bower, sir. I'm the-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You're waking from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. This is disorientation from-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: corporal... Bower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's right, I'm-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna get that fucking light out of my eyes, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... sir. PAYTON rubs his face with a frown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where... are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're aboard the Elysium. From what I've

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elysium...? Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... really know. There's no power in the com and I can't even-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the... rest of the crew? It's our shift? Our rotation-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't they suppose to be here... to wake us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... I don't know where anyone is. PAYTON takes breaths, trying to regain his senses, glanci around at their darkened surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the lights, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... we're having some power problems-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who woke you up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, not sure. It had to have been the flight computer. There's no one here... (off his look) .except us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold in here. BOWER grabs him a towel and water container, turning back see PAYTON doesn't waste any time, stretching his limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no power coming off the main grid. Can't fire any of the... (searching for word) Dynos. Can't even open the doors. PAYTON glances to the other empty sleep-chamber with a fr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his look) Our 2nd Lieutenant? I don't know where he is. It was empty when I woke up. None of the systems are on-line. Mainframe is down, so I don't know how or why it engaged independently-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I have two coffees you're just gonna have to repeat all this shit, so let's just idle here for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I just- Just glad to see you awake. i was... a little concerned. I didn't know what to do if- PAYTON gets to his feet, stumbling. BOWER catches him und the arm as they stagger into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BOWER
dialogues.text: Easy... Lieutenant. Easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man. BOWER helps him to the locker room as LIGHTS FLICKER past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON staggers along the row of storage lockers as BOWER helps guide him with the flashlight beam. PAYTON pauses w a frown as he glances across the name-plates, none of the seeming familiar. BOWER gestures toward the locker, the n plate reads: LT. PAYTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 It's... the name on your sleep pod, sir. PAYTON opens the door to see his belongings inside, a pho of WIFE (MARIANNE) inside the door. He stares at it with utter confusion. BOWER takes this in, looking to the memo recovery card inside the locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it says that the memory loss is only suppose to be a momentary loss that's-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very reassuring. I guess when you gamma the brain into extended REM, sometimes it can take a while to get it back. PAYTON pulls on his flight uniform and squeezes his feet his shoes. BOWER notices the identification tattoo on his forearm, partially obscured from view; FLT>>00... (obscured by grime, hair and angle). Unl own, PAYTON'S tattoo is faded with age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been awake for at least an hour and I still can't remember my... anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, the last time I crawled out of a hyper bunk, it took me... quite a while to get it all back. BOWER holds his frown as PAYTON squeezes his finger into wedding ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was... your last flight, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't recall. The Kuiper Belt odyssey? Don't worry, it'll come back, eventually. PAYTON kisses the photo of his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gone through this before. I just can't remember why I would agree to do it again. PAYTON goes to close his locker and BOWER motions with a serious tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? I know this is going to sound strange, but do you even know where we're going? I can remember the training, but... not the mission. Know the procedures, not the... destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you'd tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't even know the ship's name until I saw it-on the console. For all I know this was another damn training exercise-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, it's not. if this is a simulation... PAYTON notices both of their reflections off the mirrored panel inside the locker... revealing their WHITE HAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is taking the joke a little far. He shuts the locker and they exit, the flashlight's beam panning away, taking us into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER and PAYTON are standing at the control console, the screens flickering with distortion. BOWER hands him a cof and PAYTON takes a sip... with a wince of disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the activators are working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures. We can ride two hundred thousand tons of space freighter across the galaxy without a dent in the hood, but can't get one good cup of coffee. PAYTON flips a few switches with no result of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the mainframe, we can't connect. I don't know how we'll ever be able to- PAYTON is in his element at the control desk, flipping op an emergency auxiliary-power panel. He snaps open a handl and he forcefully gives it several rotations with a MOAN whirling magnetos. The hand-crank allows a dim glow of electricity to the light panels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I- didn't even think of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON gives him a look with a grin and flips a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton on the con. Respond? This is Lt. Payton of flight Team...? Shit-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five? How do you know that? BOWER pulls up his sleeve, exposing his tattoo ID. PAYTON nods, "good thinking."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Payton of Flight Team Five. Does anyone copy? Anyone... respond? Anyone awake up there? Dead static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team Four suppose to be here for the shift rotation. Where could they be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking teamsters. Maybe they couldn't get to us. BOWER eyes the third empty sleep-chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where could he have gone? PAYTON gazes off blankly. A RUMBLE of FLICKERING LIGHTS p and the computer screens slowly fade, going black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power systems must be free-floating off blown circuits or something. The over-ride grid won't even lock in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatta ya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we need to find a deck of cards and call the union. Distant THUMPS are heard overhead and they freeze... watc the ceiling with uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody... is up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Ventilation... maybe. Systems keep re-booting after each surge. That could be anything. THUMPS fade as the ship eerily MOANS and CREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we get out of here. I'd rather be up and out then stuck in the trunk. The room is blocked by the two heavy steel doors on eithe end, security doors ten feet wide. PAYTON leads the way towards one end, gesturing towards the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not far from the bridge but without the circuits locked in... I don't know how we could ever get this thing open. As they approach, their flashlight beams pan across the d to see jagged chips and scratches all along the edges. To are scattered on the floor, the control panel ripped open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Somebody was trying to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ironic. I think it was built to protect us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing to the third pod) Well, he got out... some how. A RUMBLE approaches... another SHUDDER that FLICKERS the lights. They watch the ceiling as BOWER counts in his hea as it fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cycle is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not circuitry. Reactor timing is off-set in the core. Seems sporadic, but it's not. Each revolution decreasing before starting over from the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's trying to reconnect, but it won't until it's reset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I can't remember my own- but I know everything there is to know about that damn reactor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The training stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know that... Another SHUDDER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's twelve revolutions, before recycling. And this one will only last- As they watch the ceiling, their flashlight beams stop on small ventilation shaft that's been ripped open. They exchange a look and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lights spill inside an endless steel shaft only a f and a half in diameter, leading into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if we only had a monkey and a rope. PAYTON climbs down as BOWER rotates his jaw with eagernes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our 2nd Lieutenant must have gone this way. Don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're better off... waiting here-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? If the mainframe is off-line-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to be able to get to the bridge or even be able to open that door from the other side-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can at least find out what's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember just how big this ship is, kid? We don't know where that will come out, if at all-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we can at least try to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do... Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I have to take a handful of Doxitol just to get in the hyper-bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... claustrophobic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take a lot, that's not one of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real boy scout, is that it? You get lost in there and you're a footnote in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can guide me... over two-way. PAYTON eyes him over with reluctance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's something wrong. How long can we wait in here before we have to try something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing to 2nd Lt pod) How long did he wait? Silent stare as a SHUDDER passes, flickering the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if no one else is awake and there's no one at the wheel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dig through compartments, collecting tools. BOWER pu on a boom-mic, clips the radio on his belt and tests the transmitter. PAYTON goes through a drawer of office supplies, handing him an ENVELOPE OPENER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in case... (off his look) .there's mail you need to open quickly. BOWER tucks it into a zipper pocket and his photograph fa out. PAYTON watches as he tucks it back in and zips up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wife...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be newlyweds. How can you forget something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do-you remember? Anything yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still a little fuzzy but you're the cocky little shit who wanted the window seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're the cranky old bastard who made me take the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it some more time, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER squeezes inside, pushing himself forward several fe as PAYTON peeks inside behind him. With one last look, BO holds the pen-lamp in his teeth and begins to crawl, push himself forward on his stomach, only several inches at a in a rhythmic motion. Grunt, slide, breath. Grunt, slide, breath. PAYTON'S flashlight slowly fades from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly the sound approaches... 1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grunt, slide, breath. Grunt, slide breath. BOWER'S pen-lamp slowly emerges and he pauses to catch hi breath. With anxiety shown across his sweat coated face, squints down the endless shaft. BOWER (GASPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit. PAYTON'S voice crackles over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: How we doing? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet. Christ, not a single vent opening or- Nothing. How about on your end? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON is seated at the control desk, the light panel fad He hand-cranks the auxiliary handle and then continues tapping the keys as they flicker with distortion. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power surges keep coming across in longer increments, just like you said. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna keep trying to get inside and run a dyno. Or at least try to get a pizza delivered. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER frowns as he squints down the shaft. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey? BOWER quickly pushes himself forward reaching an intersec in the shaft. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got an intersection here.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: What are the choices? The light pans to endless shafts in each direction. He SN a glow stick to life, letting it drop down the vertical shaft... silently into nothing. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whole lot of the same... nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: If you're gonna take a turn let's keep track. That way you can get back if there's no way out. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. BOWER lowers his head, breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: If you haven't seen anything yet... maybe you should head back now. BOWER sets his jaw and suddenly spots a SPIDER, gently dropping down from a string of web. It lands and quickly scurries away. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) I'll be damned. BOWER collects himself, a tightened jaw of determination. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking a left. Make a note.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Left it is. BOWER turns the corner to follow the spider's path, the g of the lamp slowly fading. DISSOLVE THRU:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of monitors FLICKER, only offering a quick glance surveillance cameras on the ship, images too quick and distorted to recognize but resembling empty corridors and vast cargo compartments. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON looks to the name plate that reads Elysium and a s emblem above it, a global shape with a spiral design. PUSH IN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stares at the emblem, it seems memories are returni a frown hardening on his face. Distant THUMPS snap him from his trance and he pans his flashlight towards the wall. THUMP... SCRAPE... THUMP. He nervously pans his light slowly up the wall and across ceiling. A shiver of uneasiness goes through him as he si trapped within the room alone. He tries to divert his fea turning to the control screen, giving the hand-crank a wh DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. Grunt, slide, breath. Grunt, struggle, breat BOWER pauses, digging for his lamp. He's soaked with swea eyes nearing desperation. Pipes are cutting through the shaft on both sides, making his crawl space even smaller much more difficult. BOWER (GASPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton? Nothing but STATIC. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton!? Do you copy!? HEY!? Finally...

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: (filled with static) I'm here. You alright? BOWER rubs the sweat from his eyes, anxiety increasing wi his heavy breathing. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. I dunno if I can- I can't tell if I'm going in circles or- There's nothing to- Can't breath- PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, pal. Breath easy. Listen to me- BOWER squirms, pushing outward against the walls of the s with an increasing panic. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want... to stand up for God's sakes! Can't breath-

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Calm down. Listen, you gave it a shot. Let's get you back here. BOWER

dialogues.text: My dream. On the way out. Real doozy. There I was at the Rose Bowl game. Naked and everyone was drunk but me. Spent two years looking for clothes. Long fucking Rose Bowl game. BOWER chuckles, his breathing growing more steady. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: You said two years. You think we've been asleep for two years?

dialogues.speaker: I PAYTON, (ON RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .eight years. BOWER pulls the photo from his sleeve pocket, shining the flashlight onto Evalon's image. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: (under his breath) That can't be right.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: What can't be? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: PAYTON ponders the thought while gazing at the ship's emb PAYTON

CONTINUED: PAYTON

dialogues.text: PAYTON gently rubs his hand across the emblem carved in t steel, brushing away the layer of dust as his finger tips TREMBLE. He pauses with a frown as a SHUDDER approaches.. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: The SHUDDER is felt inside the shaft, EVALON'S photo trembling under the flashlight beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember... being interviewed. My mother seeing me on the news. This flight was... like no other. We weren't just pilots... BOWER looks up, shining the light down the shaft as the SHUDDER fades. He pauses to see small bolts protruding fr the wall, small pieces of ripped fabric and smears of blo

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: We were... heroes. We were-

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's been... BOWER notices the droplets of sweat dripping off his chin rolling forward across the shaft floor with a frown.

dialogues.speaker: BOWER, (CONT" D)

It' nightmarish head stand, his neck twisted with all his wei on top of himself, squirming with no where to squirm.

dialogues.speaker: BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaaeirrrgh! CUT TO:

dialogues.text: PAYTON quickly leans toward the console, gripping the rad PAYTON

dialogues.text: Bower!? What happened? Bower!? All he can hear is the muffled, panicked struggle. The RUMBLE of a power surge approaches. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: Pitch BLACK. BOWER squirms, twisting and heaving inside t steel vise deathtrap. GASP, GASP, GASP! And then... The RUMBLE approaches. A SHUDDER that sends a domino effe of metallic CLANKS towards him from below. Small shafts o light break through as small vents open in the side walls His fingers dig the envelope opener from his pocket as th RUMBLE fades, CLANKING the vents shut just as... He stabs the envelope opener into an open vent. Metal ben He begins to BANG his elbow against the vent, over and ov

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower...!? Through the static comes a HOWL of victory. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... out! I'm- PAYTON breathes a heavy sigh of relief. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm- I'm inside a boot locker!

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: A what!? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm inside a God damn- He shoves outward and the door SNAPS open. He falls out, flips through the air and SLAMS to the floor, an IMPACT o the radio sends... CUT TO:

dialogues.text: Bower? Do you hear me? Bower...? Nothing but STATIC. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: BOWER digs into a storage bin, finds another flashlight a goes to a single paneled hatch. He flips the switch and .nothing. His eyes quickly search for a solution. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: A panel is BUSTED open and BOWER jabs a pipe into the gap forcing the door open. SHUSH... the hydraulic pistons ign and the hatch slides open with an echoing... THUD! He cautiously steps out into... FOLLOW THRU:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His beam of light stabs into the darkness of the massive corridor. This is our first sense of the enormity of the ship, endless steel ribbed passageways that stretch in bo directions as far as the light will illuminate. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: BOWER, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Payton? You there...? He cautiously ventures down the corridor as LIGHTS FLICKE past, getting a quick glimpse of just how incredibly far corridors run. He steps up to an intersection of corridor adjusting the frequency on his radio. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton? Can you hear me!? Dead static. He sighs, looking down each of the corridors all appearing identical and endless. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way is which? I He examines the piping that runs along the ceiling, che the direction of the valves and guesses, picking a direct He walks to the edge of the next corridor and pauses with frown. Glancing down the side corridor, fifty yards away, something is off. Within the symmetrical framing of steel there is a rounded shape that is out of place. Be cautiously steps closer as the object takes the shape of... a MAN, standing at the edge of a doorway, head slig cocked, peeking out. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...!? BOWER freezes, caught in a silent stand-off, the MAN'S motionless stare is unsettling. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...? A low RUMBLE approaches as LIGHTS FLICKER past to reveal. The MAN'S face, hauntingly contorted, swollen features. T MAN is dead, hanging from a cable around his neck, naked gutted like an animal, his feet hanging an inch off the floor. His face is brutally beaten. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... Christ. Jesus- BOWER back pedals with fear and confusion as distant THUM make him quickly click off his light and he backs away, fading into the dark. His whisper fades. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) BOWER (CONT'D) (PANICKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton...? Are you there? Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower? You there? (CLICK)

dialogues.text: Com'on, man. You there? (CLICK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower:? The familiar sound slowly returns overhead... SCRAPE... THUMP... SCRAPE. The "sounds" are heard, muffled and now closer then befor With the flashlight leading the way he explores into a co of the room, tangled with pipes.

dialogues.speaker: SCRAPE... THUMP
dialogues.text: Something is just beyond the wall, trying to get in. PAYT back pedals, searching for any form of a weapon. He SNAPS the handle off a storage bin, wielding it like a baseball as he slowly back pedals to the control desk. He continues his search across the radio channels, keepin his eyes toward the corner as... his FINGERS on the switc seem to be TREMBLING with more intensity. PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower? Can you hear me? (CLICK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bower? Answer me, God dammit. DISSOLVE THRU BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUSH... THUD! BOWER forces open a single paneled hatch d and cautiously enters into an institutional style mess ha Hundreds of lunch tables and chairs. Random SPARKS of lig erupt from neon lights overhead. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he moves across the massive room, the neatly lined row gradually become more dishevelled, chairs knocked over an unknown liquid dripping from the tables. Garbage litters floor, a dim glow of light emerging from the galley. He crawls along the edge of the counter and peeks inside galley, horribly ran-sacked. In the midst of the wreckage darkened FIGURE is seen scavenging through the cupboards, angrily tossing empty containers aside. The FIGURE pauses, sensing a presence and glances back as BOWER ducks. He contemplates, pulling out the envelope opener and slowly peeks back out and... POW! He's HIT in the face, blood spraying, slamming onto back. The pen-lamp and envelope opener spin across the floor. BOWER tries to get up and he's grabbed by the hair blade pressed against his neck. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman's voice growls into his ear, in German. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keine Bewegung! BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-!? He tries to look up and... CRACK! Instant swelling over h eye from a hit. She kicks the envelope opener away. NADIA (GERMAN ACCENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! BOWER (DAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you move MOTHER FUCKER! She quickly pats him down, stealing tools. All he can see her bare feet, blackened from oil. He frowns to see her t nails painted with bright pink polish. NADIA, a torn jump suit, snarled hair hiding her face, sk smeared with oil. A beautiful woman underneath an apocalyptic smear of grunge. Her hair is pure white, high lighted with smears of oil. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait- I'm part of the crew! I'm- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK! A hit silences him and the forceful frisk continue She pauses to see Evalon's photograph, throwing it aside. grabs the photo and she shoves the blade deeper into his neck. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: DON'T FUCKING MOVE
dialogues.text: BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't! Please! Just listen- I'm not- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take them off! BOWER

dialogues.text: What!? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOES! I'll gut your ass- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Bower? You there-? BOWER lunges and they go into a violent spin, crashing ov table. Dishes clatter, gasps and grunts... only glimpses the fight through the flicker of light. CRACK! BOWER'S hit, sent flying and he looks up to see he silhouette approaching, edged weapon in her hand. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop it! Listen to me! Hold it! she attacks and he frantically throws dishes and chairs t fend her off. She throws the blade, the blunt end deflect off his forearm. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy fucking bitch- He wields the only weapon he can find... his shoe. And he attack abruptly halts, slowly back pedalling with fright. BOWER is confused, realizing her eyes are looking past hi A BLUISH GLOW seeps in from the doorway, approaching from corridor. He looks back to see NADIA is running for the kitchen... gone. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (3) BOWER (CONT'D) SHIT-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ducks below the tables as a FIGURE slowly enters the r carrying a long steel spear-like device with a splinter o blinding BLUE FIRE on the tip, fueled with a chemical spr like a welder's torch. His obstructed view reveals the FIGURE as a tribal warrio scantily clad, elongated muscular frames, pale skin coate hydraulic fluid. Bald head with clumps of tangled hair. I moves smoothly and silently, jabbing the tip of the flami device into each corner and crevasse, as if flushing out anything hidden. BOWER (CONT-D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) What the hell is- The FIGURE quickly spins his direction and SNAPS a lever the spear-device, killing the blue flame and taking us instantly into darkness. BOWER holds his breath with fright, back pedalling on his knees as his eyes try to adjust to the dark. He takes an uneasy breath to realize... there is more then one. Slowly moving out of the shadows, four more HUNTERS slowl emerge, like a unified pack on the prowl. They carry an assortment of crudely made weapons, spears and blades of sharpened metal. The apparent leader of the pack is HEFLIN, the largest an strongest of the group and he directs the pack with an assortment of odd vocal sounds, deep HISSES from the thro and gargled CACKLES. On command, the one HUNTER flips a lever and the BLUE FLA crackles back to life with a burst of flammable liquid. T hunt continues, the pack weaving through the debris, following NADIA'S path. As the BLUISH GLOW fades, BOWER is left bewildered and terrified. Suddenly, his radio sounds...

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Is that you!? Bower-- BOWER frantically flips it off as one of the HUNTERS sudd turns back. E

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEASEL, a small framed hunter searches the area like a hunting dog, sniffing the spot. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (4)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On closer examination, WEASEL is coated with war paint an decorative scars marking his skin. BOWER POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only clear view is off an overturned bowl that shows WEASEL'S face, oddly contorted in the rounded reflection. WEASEL is headed directly for BOWER until.., a HISS from HEFLIN calls him back. WEASEL takes one last look before turning back, the torch fades from view, taking us into black. We hear... BOWER'S breath, heightened gasps of fear as he begins to crawl away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. Sounds of the ship surround us along with th occasional FLICKER of LIGHT. A whispered conversation between BOWER and the radio slowly comes into ear-shot as find him, hidden beneath a console.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: (muffled with static) .with that marking, she's got to be part of the passenger manifest. Possibly a glitch in the LFS support system, a breakdown in the main grid must have woken passengers, instead of the flight crew. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, why would she try to kill me!? She was going to slit my throat! And why would they look like that?

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Look like what? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have seen these guys. They were... a very fucked up looking gang. Why the hell would they be-- Payton, they were hunting. BOWER gives himself a shiver as he fearfully checks over shoulder, eyes shifting with fear.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Hunting!? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sure-as-shit weren't a welcoming party from the Promenade deck! These guys were... looking to do some damage.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Take it easy- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to try to contact the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: You're assuming there is someone on the bridge. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not!? We're not the only ones awake. Team Four wouldn't go back to sleep without waking us for rotation. Maybe they're on the main deck? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON goes to the doors, coated with desperate scrapes a dents. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're in there... why haven't they thrown the security hammer into lock down? Seal and freeze it until the emergency units wake? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they can't. With the systems kicking on and off- Maybe they're flying blind, with no control of the LFS? PAYTON eyes the scattered tools across the floor and the ripped open ventilation shaft. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way we can't assume help will be coming. On-board or off. Out here, there is no rescue. There is no turning around. This thing wasn't even built... .to return. He pauses off the involuntary memory relapse, looking to I computer screens, taking in the thought. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? PAYTON glances across the control console, nodding with m memories returning. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no regular transport. We're not out collecting data off the belt or hauling cargo... we are the cargo. It was a single launch trajectory for... That's as far as his memory allows, his words trailing of CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER completes his thought, in a daze. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .Tanis. Planetary processing and population. We're a settler's vessel. (HAUNTING REALIZATION)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elysium. This was a one-way ticket. BOWER'S gaze goes distant as... FLASH IMAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another place, another time, BOWER leans closer on a bed, watching EVALON sleep. There is a a deep love in his eyes BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) How could I have... left her? Why would I have done that? I loved her... BOWER snaps out of his trance. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton!? Where is your wife? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't leave them behind. No one did. They're on this flight! Remember the recruitment. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fucking breeding tests- The wives, the husbands- The- She's on this God damn flight! CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON is remembering, eyes widening with the realization not completely at ease with the thought.

dialogues.speaker: BOWER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: They're here. Somewhere on board. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a new energy of determination, BOWER crawls out of h hiding place, panning the light to reveal the compartment I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: officer's living quarters. The room is designed in a circular shape, angling up the wall at a ninety degree an He quickly begins to search for tools and weapons. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to find her... before those fucking animals do! I've got to- BOWER ransacks the compartments, tossing aside items. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to think of where they would be? A sleeping compartment for non-service PERSONNEL OR- PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, hold it! Think about this for a SECOND BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there to think about!? I remember! There was thousands of passengers that weren't part of the development team. Families that- PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, listen to me! LISTEN! You know how big this ship is and there's no way of knowing exactly where- If you go on some wild goose chase to try to find her- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: I HAVE TO-
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we would be no closer to getting out of this situation with even less time to regain control of the ship. BOWER stews, wanting to retort, his mind is racing. PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our job is to obtain control of this ship. Once we've taken control of the systems, finding them would be easy. Are you hearing me? We save the ship... we can save them all. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... how do we- I r PAYTON Where are you? I BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panning the light) I dunno. Officer's quarters, somewhere above D-level, I think- I don't- PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can guide you. Find out where you are. Hatch marker. Over the door. His flashlight finds one of the hatch doors and he climbs the slanted wall to read the marker. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: D-71643-L.
dialogues.text: PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. Climbing up the angled furnishings, he searches for any available weapon. He notices a mantel that displays sever antique astrological and navigation devices. He spots an antique pistol. He breaks the glass, grabbing the gun, bu it crumbles under his grip, falling to pieces. He sighs, but pauses to see... because the furniture is angled, his light spots a hiding spot underneath the desk He pulls out a silver flask, bone dry. He reaches further pulling out an unusually shaped weapon, much like a sawed shotgun with rounded edges. He snaps open the hand-crank I lever and gives a forceful whirl. A slow MOAN of magnet causes the weapon's lights to dimly come to life. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs upward to an open hatch in the ceiling as we... ANGLE ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground, there is a small fish tank, completely with a tiny fish skeleton laying on the bottom. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON spins the hand-crank, allowing the computer screen glow brighter. He quickly works the keyboard, pulling up diagram of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Alright. I'll lay out a path for you and see if we can by-pass the main security doors.

dialogues.speaker: BOWER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: Guide me to where? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back toward the flight decks. Back to me.

dialogues.speaker: BOWER, (ON RADIO)
dialogues.text: I'm not coming back to you. What good would that do? I can't open that door from the other side-- PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What chance have you got out there on your own? We'll figure out a way to breach the command bridge- A power surge sends a SHUDDER and FLICKERING LIGHTS past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same shudder of FLICKERING LIGHTS passes BOWER as he looks down the endless stretch of corridors, pondering.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (ON RADIO)
