dialogues.text: Knock it off! Both of ya! TANAKA and NADIA slowly recover, both quickly try to find their weapons on the floor. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... nobody needs to get hurt here. Both of you just... cool out. And stop throwing that shit. Her eyes dart with uneasiness as she finds her knife. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all just... go easy here. I understand it's been every man for himself around here lately, but if we're going to get out of this- A little God damn solidarity wouldn't hurt. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can work together here. We all want the same thing... right? NADIA remains poised, ready to fight, knife raised. Sighi with defeat, BOWER gestures, hands raised as he motions f TANAKA and they slowly back towards the door. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning to Tanaka) Thanks... again. TANAKA motions toward the emblem on his uniform and gestu to himself. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. I get it. We can work together on this, right? TANAKA grins. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we understand each other. They head out of the room as... NADIA watches from the shadows with a curious frown. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER and TANAKA head down the corridor, both of them checking their backs as they come to a sealed doorway. TANAKA is still wincing, rubbing his chest with pain. TANAKA (BITTERLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Japanese- No Subtitles BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well no sympathy here. She left me with a few sore spots too, pal. They both go to work, attempting to wedge the door open w pipes. BOWER looks back to see... NADIA. They back pedal with weapons in hand and NADIA is unaffected, watching th with a frown. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, lady. We don't want any- NADIA (SOBERLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... part of the flight crew? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm... a corporal, I'm- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think there was any flight crew left. What's happened to us? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm trying to figure out. Malfunction of some sort- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, you think? Where are you going? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm heading for the reactor bay. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just wake up? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just joining the program already in progress, yeah. She eyes him over and TANAKA keeps the pipe raised. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never make it. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? And why is that? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going the wrong direction. She grimaces and turns, heading back up the corridor. BOW and TANAKA exchange a look. BOWER chases after her. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey? Wait a second- HEY? NADIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SSSSH! Keep it down- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Who are you? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait- Can't join the team without a name. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Team? Why would I want to join? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I need you to show me the way. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the reactor? No thanks. Don't like going that fax down. No one ever comes back. She continues up the corridor and BOWER grabs her arm. Sh yanks away from his touch, squaring off, weapon in hand. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Please- There's not much time left before we lose everything onboard. You understand what I'm trying to- I NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where this ship is headed? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fly it? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you fly it... if you have to? BOWER (NOT SURE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. NADIA eyes him over, sizing him up. NADIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you as close to it as I can. But, I won't wait for you. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER nods with a frown and she heads up the corridor. BO and TANAXA watch on. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (3) TANAKA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Japanese- No Subtitles. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My thoughts exactly. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTS FLICKER past as... NADIA leads them down a long corridor that widens into an atrium of shafts going into the darkness in every directi The further their lights pan across the shafts... a stran assortment of odd colored algae and moss is revealed grow up the walls of the shafts. TANAKA keeps a watchful eye as BOWER frowns at the surroundings. BOLTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where you're going? This doesn't... "feel" right. (NO RESPONSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been awake? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know. There's no way to tell time in here. Two... maybe three months. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: MONTHS
dialogues.text: His voice echoes across the cavernous atrium and she glar NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! You wanna get us killed!? BOWER (WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you have- You telling me people have been running around on board for several months!? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longer. I wasn't the first one up. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: HIGH ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their flashlight beams continue across the enormous room two small searchlights. She leads them down into a side shaft, their lights fade from view. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NADIA stops at the foot of a large steel door, gesturing them to crouch in the shadows, watching the corridor. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? What are we doing- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i Shush! We're waiting. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for what-? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! At the far end of the corridor, a faint BLUISH GLOW grows stronger. Shadows are moving, growing closer. BOWER SHIT-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NADIA gestures for them to stay put. TANAKA wants to leav but BOWER grabs his shoulder. They both grip weapons, glancing to NADIA as the HUNTERS seem to be headed their BOWER (CONT-D) WE CAN'T- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssssht! The HISS and CACKLES of the HUNTERS grow closer and it se they're shortly going to be cornered and done for until.. A SHUDDER is felt, a FLICKER of LIGHTS approaching. She g to a control panel, holds down a switch and presses her p F across a scanner. As the power SURGE passes, the control panel activates, scanning her hand and the steel door activates with a MOA hydraulics. BOWER notices her ID tattoo; BIO-T>>218 (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHUDDER passes, killing the power and the door stops. open only a half foot. She squeezes through and BOWER and TANAKA quickly follow. They help her push it shut, sealin the lock with a CLANK. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NADIA secures the lock on the door and jams a pipe in the handles, her own added insurance. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they? What the hell are those things? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Never quite felt like sticking around to find out. Running... is always the best option. Believe me. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not- They can't be from this ship. They don't seem... human. Do you think something got on board or maybe I something... He turns to follow her and pauses to see... The BIO-VAULT. A large lab storage compartment that has b "lived-in" for a long time. A bed has been created from assorted chair cushions and there is a collection of scavenged items. NADIA adds to the items, dumping the belongings of her bag onto the floor. BOWER is in awe as he approaches an entire wall of glass tubes, a maze of micro-biological containers, glimmering condensation. BOWER (CONT-D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is... all this? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecological Development, Embryonic Charter. Livestock and wildlife re- population. The rows of glass tubes are labelled, ranging from mounta goats to octopi, everything a new world would need. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NADIA checks a few gauges on the wall of tubes and makes adjustments on the monitoring system. He senses her meticulous care for the material. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been living in here? You're... protecting it? NADIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It' seems to be the only living thing left on this ship worth protecting. Regardless of the situation, we still have a mission. We've only lost about thirty percent of the specimens, mostly reptilian class. Never was big into snakes anyway. BOWER doesn't share the attempt at humor, wandering towar darkened digital screen on the wall, displaying a charted graph of the new planet, TANIS. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Tanis. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his look) You couldn't remember? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I- I didn't remember just how far away it is... until now. This was a hundred and twenty-three year flight. NADIA begins to gather a few items shoving them into a ba TANAKKA leans closer to the glass display with fascinatio tapping the tubes to see movement inside. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I have forgotten that? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It comes only in pieces. Even after a few months. I know everything about this vault and its systems... but I still can't remember where I grew up. Or my brother's name. Only pieces... And the training comes back first. For good reason, I guess. BOWER eyes the darkened computer terminals, portions of t consoles coated in algae. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could we have become like this... in only eight years? NADIA ponders the thought, rotating her jaw. She digs int her supplies and tosses him a small block of orange mater BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dehydrated meatloaf. House special. I save 'em for the weekends. BOWER sniffs it with a sneer and tries to break off a piece... hard as a rock. NADIA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how long it would take to turn dehydrated meatloaf into that? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but it takes more then a couple years to turn coal into fucking diamonds. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we've over slept? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ship was built to outlast our children's children... and any engineer could tell ya the warranty is running out. I think we've been asleep longer then you may think. BOWER tosses the orange brick. to TANAKA and he sniffs it a grin, breaking off a piece. NADIA finishes gathering to and she slings the bag over her shoulder, "ready to go". BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a radio? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Who the hell is there to call? (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (3) BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the only flight crew officer awake. We're not in this alone. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON is asleep, seated on the floor, back to the wall. is awoken by...

dialogues.speaker: RATTLE... THUMP, THUMP
dialogues.text: He instantly grips the pipe and turns on the flashlight. "SOUNDS" are closer then ever before as something is hear crawling towards the panel in the ventilation shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vent panel lightly RATTLES, the metal begins to bend. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want in? Come and get it you fu- The screwdriver SNAPS and the panel hits the floor. PAYTO raises the pipe, preparing to fight and... A desperate ga is heard from inside the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: GALLO, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Help... me! PAYTON pauses, angling the light inside to see... GALLO, young flight officer, boyish innocence, short-cropped hai heavily coated in sweat, desperation in his eyes. His hai is dark brown, the only person without pure white hair. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell... are you!? GALLO is tightly wedged inside the shaft, squirming to cr out, trembling with fear and exhaustion. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me- I'm part- of the flight crew! I'm- Please- HELP ME! PAYTON oddly hesitates... before lowering the weapon. He digs into the shaft grabbing GALLO'S hand, pulling him ou GALLO collapses onto the floor, crumbling into a fetal position, naked. His hands are locked in claw-like grips, trembling uncontrollably. His gasps are rapid and unstead (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... Easy. You're all right. PAYTON runs to grab a towel and water. As he turns back h notices GALLO'S hip and legs are sprayed with dried blood PAYTON kneels over him and GALLO spasms from his touch. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: PAAARRRGH
dialogues.text: PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EASY! I'm here to help you! PAYTON lifts the bottle to his lips, but the water runs d his face, GALLO is frozen in shock. PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Com'on. Try to drink a little. Here. GALLO is unresponsive, wide eyes locked in a trance. PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name? Huh? Can you hear me? GALLO (MUMBLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gallo. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Gallo...? PAYTON frowns, mumbling the name with a hint of recogniti PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal... Gallo? GALLO (TREMBLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you come from, Gallo? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The... bridge. Saying the words seems to send him into a terrified tranc PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge!? Where are we? What's happened? Can you tell me- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more PAYTON inquires, the more GALLO begins to unrave emotionally. His eyes widen with terror, breath quickenin PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporal? GASP, GASP, GASP... PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me... what happened? GALLO is hyper-ventilating, eyes wide with terror. A drop of blood slowly builds in his nostril, refusing to drip. low whine is heard in his throat as... LIGHTS FLICKER pas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hatch is broken open and BOWER'S flashlight beam peers a ventilation shaft. Twenty feet inside the shaft the wal are collapsed, blocking passage. NADIA sighs with dread. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't get through this way. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer to stay on foot. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the safest way to travel. And there's only one other way to get through that I know of. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is that? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT, PERSONNEL SLEEP CHAMBER/MAIN CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Light breaks through as our gang wedges open a door, all sneering in unison when hit by an odor. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Main corridor. Hyper-sleep chamber, Personnel. Keep your light down. (CONTINUED)     I
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads the way along the wall and into a compartment o unimaginable size, fifty foot high steel walls that chann through the room. The walls are lined with hundreds of sl chambers, stacked ten high on either side. They round a corner into the main atrium to see dishevell equipment and smashed control consoles, scarred from batt Old blood stains are worn deeply into the floor. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... As they venture deeper inside they see numerous sleep- chambers, open hatches and empty. The further they move along the wall, more and more empty pods, too many to cou BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. They're... empty. They're all- Where the hell is everyone? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep quiet. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dozens and dozens of nameplates move past his flashlight, BOWER pauses. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. My wife- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait. My wife could be in here. BOWER'S focus completely shifts, turning towards the pods reading name plates. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she do? What's her specialty? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not part of the crew, but spouses were brought with. I remember there were- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she's not in here. This is development settlers. Engineers. NADIA quickly continues as BOWER tries to keep up. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where the family members are- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) NADIA (GROWL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet! They look to see TANAKA has fallen behind, crouched and peering off towards the dark. He's poised like a dog on t prowl that's caught a bad scent. They crouch and crawl to the adjacent corner. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see what he's looking at, do you? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to keep moving. We don't want to stay out in the open for too long. Especially in here. BOWER (TO TANAKA)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...? Let's go! Distant THUMPS are heard somewhere in the room and they tighten up with their weapons, eyes scanning. TANAKA refu to look away, poised like a hunter. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stay herel NADIA heads across the main floor and BOWER tries to wave on, but TANAKA is locked onto something, refusing to wave BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here! Com'on- The THUMPS grow louder and TANAKA heads into the shadows. BOWER hesitates, turning to follow NADIA through a barric of dishevelled equipment, leaving TANAKA behind. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER emerges from the barricades into a processing cente for loading passengers, darkened and in shambles. NADIA i scanning the corridors ahead, choosing her path as BOWER rushes to catch her. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just leave him. We have to wait- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you wait... and find your own way. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't split up the team, it's all WE'VE GOT- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I'm not going to wait. I'm not gonna get myself killed for- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy saved my life twice already. I'm not gonna leave him- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think he's doing in there!? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hunting! Bagging the next notch on his belt. You wait for him! Good luck. I NADIA quickly heads deeper into the room and down a dar and narrowing tunnel. BOWER hesitates with frustration. Having to choose, he turns and chases after NADIA. I They crawl through a maze of machinery and NADIA'S pace difficult for BOWER to keep up. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! I'm coming- There's a CRUNCH under his foot. He lowers his light, picking up a small white object. He brings it closer to t light to realize it's... A HUMAN FINGER BONE. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! NADIA turns toward him to see... REVERSE ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind BOWER is a massive stack of human skeletons and carcasses. They've just crawled into a pit of human remai They both back away with horror only to see a mountain of carcasses on both sides. The only route is upward and the begin to crawl up the slope on their bellies, over dead remains. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) BOWER (CONT'D) (HORRIFIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God! Wait- Where are we going!? NADIA suddenly grabs him, a quick jerk to silence him. A SHADOW passes with a CACKLING HISS. They freeze, laying o top of the remains, the bones CRINKLING underneath them. The HISS grows stronger... and they look up to see a silhouetted HUNTER crouched over like a gargoyle on a raf leering in their direction. NADIA (WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. They try to remain motionless, but the slope of the remai i CRINKLES underneath them and the hill of remains begins slide. The HISS grows stronger. They hold their position until... a SHUDDER approaches wi FLICKERING LIGHTS. The power surge is enough to ignite a small landslide underneath them. BOWER SHIT-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NADIA grabs his arm as bones snap and they slide helpless to the bottom within a landslide of bones and flesh. The finally slide to a stop at the bottom of the slope an BOWER quickly raises his weapon towards the rafters to se the HUNTER is gone. NADIA (WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where... did it go-? He pans the light and... ROAR! The HUNTER lunges at them from five feet away. BOWER is STRUCK with enough force to send him flying, CRASHING into a pile of bones. NADIA spins around with a bladed pipe in her hands... but HUNTER is already gone. She spins back and... THWAP! She' HIT from behind and sent with break-neck force into the floor. The HUNTER pounces onto her back and a claw-like h grabs her hair... teeth opening towards her neck and... POW! BOWER charges into the HUNTER, tackling it and they spin into a brutal and distorted fight, seen under the FLICKERING LIGHT. Even though the HUNTER is a smaller one the pack, smaller then BOWER, its speed and strength is i human. It grabs BOWER by the head with a GROWL and... (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWACK! TANAKA lunges out of the shadows, delivering a bl with his bladed pipe into the HUNTER'S face. It's a hit t would normally kill anything, nearly taking its head off. The HUNTER stumbles, staggers and... HIIIISSSSSST! It HIT TANAKA, sending him airborne, nearly knocking him out. Under the FLICKERING LIGHT, BOWER, NADIA and TANAKA all attack the lone HUNTER, taking all three of them to bring to the floor. They viciously pound it with pipes and blad until it finally stops flinching beneath them. Its pale white skin seeps a thick black colored blood. Th three of them back away, gasping and coated in its blood. BOWER (GASPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... Christ- Jesus- Its face is smashed beyond recognition, but its facial features are horrifically distorted, no sign of eyes unde the shredded tissue. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the... what the hell is it!? The HUNTER flinches and our gang back pedals with fright. NADIA continues back pedalling, looking towards the rafte to see... HEFLIN silhouetted, leering towards them. NADIA ANOTHER ONE-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER quickly finds his weapon on the floor and HEFLIN sl begins to TAP his spear against the wall, echoing a conti clank through the hull. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he... doing? BOWER, NADIA and TANAKA quickly realize the effect as sha begin to move.., the room is filling with HUNTERS, alerte the tapping of metal. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're... everywhere- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (4)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A low gargled HISS is heard from HEFLIN'S throat. NADIA is already gone. BOWER and TANAKA chase after her a the walls come to life, HUNTERS swarming onto their path a pack of wild dogs. Before diving through the barricade, BOWER looks back to HEFLIN and his pack have paused... to eat the fallen HUNT CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a panicked and mad dash through the dark as they cra through the barricade and run back into the main corridor sleep chambers. HUNTERS can be heard closing on their tra They round a corner and NADIA jumps inside an empty sleep chamber, frantically trying to pull the hatch closed. TAN follows suite, jumping inside another chamber and BOWER scrambles, in search of an open door as footsteps are hea quickly approaching. In a frenzied panic, BOWER dives into the chamber with NA tugging the hatch closed. FOLLOW THRU:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER and NADIA are cheek to cheek in the cramped space, gasping for breath and dripping sweat with terror. Through the porthole... silhouetted HUNTERS move past wit weapons in hand, search and destroy style. One HUNTER ste up only a few feet from their porthole and they freeze, holding their breath. Slowly the HUNTERS continue past, t shadows slowly fading from sight. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened to them!? What the hell are those things!? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up! They listen for a long moment... hearing nothing as BOWER looks at his hand, finger tips trembling. CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch door inches open and BOWER peeks out. He and NA crawl out quietly to see TANAKA waiting for them. TANAKA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Japanese - No subtitles. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I second that. Let's get the fuck out of here. Which way did we come from? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go back? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean... let's just go! NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go back. Find a different path. I don't think we can get through to the reactor bay from- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said there was no other path. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready to explore other options- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way did they go-? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to discuss it here!? A RUMBLE is heard approaching and they all crouch in unis It's a power surge that sends FLICKERING LIGHTS across th massive corridor and a BLINKING LIGHT is activated on a nearby sleep-chamber. And then... BANG! The hatch door is KICKED from the inside, white gas erupting from the seam. Our gang quickly crawls toward th shadows, crouching behind equipment to watch as... Another KICK bursts open the hatch and a BIG PASSENGER cr out, slamming onto the floor with a shiver of agony, gasp for breath, muscles twitching. BIG PASSENGER

dialogues.speaker: AA.AAAA.RGH
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BIG PASSENGER tries to get to his feet, gasping and heaving, mumbling in Russian. BOWER tries to stand but NA pulls him back. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing-!? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll hear him- They'll- We've got to HELP HIM-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps thunder across the floor and... WHACK! The BIG PASSENGER is STRUCK by a single blow from HEFLIN. The HUNTERS have returned in full force and they come out of shadows from every direction, bladed weapons spinning. BOWER pulls away from NADIA'S grip and prepares to interv but TANAKA suddenly grabs him, holding him back with forc With the BIG PASSENGER wounded and moaning on the floor, HUNTERS gather in a circle in ceremonial fashion, praying thanks for the feast the ship has presented. They watch helplessly as the BIG PASSENGER is then brutal attacked and eaten alive. WEASEL leads other HUNTERS unde the flickering light in a demented and twisted celebrator dance, a frenzy of pure evil. This attack is heard more then it is seen, under flickeri lights, obscured view and most of the camera angles on Bo and the groups reactions. Frozen in horror, BOWER is tugged by TANAKA, following NA to the corner where she's lifted a grate in the floor. Th climb into a shaft under the floor and into the dark as.. The SCREAMS and HISSES echo through the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAYTON is seated at the control desk, scrolling across ra frequencies, talking softly into the boom mic.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: Bower? Do you copy? You out there? Dead static. He sighs and glances toward GALLO, passed ou on a nearby bunk. He hesitates, holding the pipe as a weapon, tucking it away and cautiously approached GALLO f closer inspection. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels his neck for a pulse. He notices the dried blood under his nose then gently pulls aside the blanket to see GALLO'S identification tattoo, reading; FLT>>004&gt PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frowning to himself) Team Four. Flight Team... Four? He glances up to see GALLO is now awake, staring at him. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just... checking you. GALLO narrows his eyes, pulling the blanket tighter. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To make sure you're... alright. You... passed out. You- GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payton... Lieutenant Payton. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant? You're... a lieutenant? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You're Team Four? You're suppose to be... my predecessor. GALLO deepens his frown, glancing around with disorientat PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said... you came from the bridge? GALLO shifts his eyes back on him, a bad topic. GALLO (LEERY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. So...? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? I can't get guidance off this system and I have no idea where- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what did you see? How did-- GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm not a navigator. Stars all look alike. I don't know! How the hell would I know!? Sensing GALLO is about to break down again, PAYTON tries calmer approach. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy. I just want to make sure... GALLO'S hands are trembling, uncontrollably. PAYTON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .you're okay- GALLO tucks his shaking hands under the blanket, defensiv GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. PAYTON lowers his stare, hesitating, glancing across the dried blood still splattered across his legs. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your blood... Corporal? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of it is... sir. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose blood is it? GALLOholds his stare, jaw muscles tightening. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't give me any choice. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who didn't? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was something wrong with them. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i Something was wrong with who? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTINUED: (3)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his stare, he understands the implication.

dialogues.speaker: PAYTON, (CONT' D)
dialogues.text: Your crew? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was... Pandorum. (off his look) Of the worst sort. They were- I couldn't even- I had to defend myself. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandorum. Both of them-? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me? PAYTON (UNCONVINCED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. PAYTON goes to a nearby compartment, popping open a First case; inside is a pistol-gripped syringe. He turns back a GALLO squares off, clenched fists. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? What is that? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a sedative. Help you relax- GALLO lifts his fists with a threatening posture. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you take it... and relax. PAYTON backs off, setting the syringe aside. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. We're on the same team here. Alright? GALLO (FLATLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Lieutenant. PAYTON turns back to the control console and continues hi search across the radio frequencies. He discreetly pulls pipe weapon closer to his seat. GALLO holds a hollow stare on the back of his head. I (CONTINUED)     77- CONTINUED: (4) GALLO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you would have seen them... you would have done the same thing... sir. LIGHTS FLICKER past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLICKER of LIGHT passes to reveal... BOWER crouched ins a three-foot high, narrow passageway, a crawl space benea steel grated floor. He follows the tunnel into a large si lined with octagonal filters. TANAKA and NADIA are both looking for a way out, jabbing pipes into the grate overhead, unable to budge it. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't we come through here already? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta find a way out. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out? Why did we come iii-? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to get us out of there alive- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you knew where you were going. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to save our asses- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could've mentioned that after the first mile. If I would have known we'd be doing laps down here- She angrily turns towards him, pipe in her hand. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need to help you at all! You and the Hong-Kong Express would still be playing ding-dong-ditch on level eight if it weren't for me! Their heightening confrontation is halted by... TANAKA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIIISSST! ( .and whispered Japanese) (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pause to hear... CLASSICAL MUSIC echoing from below. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that? They climb down the shaft, jumping from filter to filter. one level they follow the sound into a shaft opening and towards the soft, warm GLOW of YELLOW LIGHT. They reach an open hatch, peering inside to see... Inside an empty storage tank, a comfortable living space been created; numerous chairs surround a make-shift dinne table made from storage crates with hand-made candles and various food containers. The tank appears empty. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this!? BOWER and TANAKA begin to climb through and NADIA hesitat with uncertainty. They crawl through the hatch... FOLLOW THRU:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb into the empty tank, lined with valves and filtration screens. The music is playing from crackling speakers hidden in the darkened circular catwalk overhead TANAKA goes straight for the food and as soon as NADIA st through the hatch... a wire SNAPS! Levers clank and a mou trap has triggered... SLAMMING the hatch closed. Trapped! They instantly turn back to the door, yanking and tugging a panic. BOWER pans his light towards the catwalk only to see a FIGURE (LELAND) scampering through the shadows. Another lever is turned and... F00000SH! A stream of vapo shoots out of several vents along the wall. The colorless gas hits them and they instantly gag, choking for air. With the slanted walls of the tank, there seems to be no escape, but TANAKA runs up the wall, diving and grabbing a pipe, climbing upward toward the catwalk. The shadowed FIGURE (LELAND) quickly hobbles to the raili LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Back in der' big boy! (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LELAND uses a spear to jab TANAKA'S hand. He loses his gr and tumbles back to the bottom of the tank. BOWER pulls NADIR out of the way of the hatch. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! BACK! BOWER whirls the magneto lever on the weapon and he raise the barrel towards the hatch, nearly point blank. KA-CRAAAACK! The energy blast from the weapon hits the ha like a lightening bolt sending a tremendous JOLT through entire tank. A spark IGNITES the chemical gas and there's BURST of flammable gas that rolls upward into the catwalk LELAND is knocked off his feet and he GASPS with shock. LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... WHOA! What the hell was that!? LELAND is exposed from his hiding place, waving the smoke from his face, bewildered. He's an older man who's lost a vanity over survival. A thin-framed, spidery little man w assorted clothing and a clutter of tools on his belt. LELAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do!? BOWER whirls the lever on the weapon and points it at him BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut off the gas! LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get that? BOWER angles the barrel towards a vent blowing out the chemical gas and LELAND jumps with fright. LELAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: NO-NO
dialogues.text: BOWER

dialogues.speaker: SHUT IT OFF
dialogues.text: LELAND scampers across the catwalk and quickly lifts leve and twists nozzles, shutting off the flow of chemical gas His frown transforms to a grin, raising an eye brow as he stares into the barrel of BOWER'S weapon. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fancy looking piece. Looking to trade? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICKITY-CLICKITY-CLANK? LELAND cranks an energy lever th ignites a string of auxiliary lights around the tank, widening their view of the unusual living space. Several crates and an assortment of mechanical junk and supplies. LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Com'in, com'in! Make yerselves at home. Just throw the coats on the bed and don't pet the rat, it's not mine. Just watching it for a friend. LELAND is excited to have guests as he runs along the catwalks, lighting candles and sealing valves. They watch him with leery suspicion, weapons still in hand. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... live here? LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sublet. Got a roomier flat in the bow for the off season, but from here, ya just can't beat the commute. He grins, expecting a laugh, but doesn't get one. LELAND eyes BOWER over, admiring the uniform. LELAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really a flyer, or did ya grab that off the rack? i didn't think there was any crew left. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left? Have you seen any? LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, only the captain. informally, mind you. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain? Where!? LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Umm, up on B-Deck. Some on C. A few pieces on the promenade and I think his nuts are in the foose-ball game in the rec room. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, revealing several missing teeth. No one laughs LELAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough crowd. Com'in, com'in. Grab a bunk. Three singles or will a queen do? LELAND laughs to himself, digging through supplies. BOWER scans the walls, seeing no way up to the catwalks. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come on down so we can meet properly? LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no-no. No-can-do. I'm real touchy to the dust bug and who knows where yawl have been. No offense. There's something funky going around. But don't let that spoil the party. Here... LELAND lowers down a bin filled with assorted food items, using a wire to drop it to them. TANAKA sniffs it with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: I LELAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's Kosher. BOWER peeks through one of the valves, turning to NADIA. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you think we are? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Gotta be somewhere below B- deck. LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, where you gotta be? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reactor bay. Know where it is? LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reactor? Now why would you want to go down there? (GRIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just woke up, didn't cha? CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small propane flame is lit. LELAND hovers over a make- shift stove, heating a can of water. He pours in some pow and stirs it up with the meticulous nature of a chef preparing fine cuisine. LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tough to properly season with a motor oil base. But if you use your imagination, kinda tastes like... (SIP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herb and garlic dog shit. Below the catwalks, TANAKA has found a spot to rest, NADI using water to clean a wound and BOWER is peering through slit in a vent. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been awake? LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm. Lemme think. What's today, Tuesday? That would be about, mmm... He counts in his head and across his fingers, carefully calculating, then a grin. LELAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. He turns back to his make-shift stove, chuckling to himse LELAND (CONT-D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit counting after the band broke up, ooooh twenty... thirty years ago. BOWER and NADIR exchange a look of uncertainty. The classical music begins to SKIP and without even looking LELAND kicks a piece of equipment, correcting the music. LELAND (CONT-D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then again, an hour in this place feels more like... one-fifteen, one-twenty. Know whatta I mean? HA-HP_W! (SOBERLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not naming names but I'm writing a very strongly worded letter to the airline. LELAND chuckles, nodding to TANAKA. TANAKA glares. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: LELAND (CONT-D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just treat each day like it's Christmas. Festive and violent. Let's eat; Shall we? Who needs a bib? LELAND sets several bowls of soup into the bin and lowers to them with the cable. T_ANAKA is the only one intereste sniffing the soup with a glare. LELAND winks. BOWER takes a seat, showing exhaustion and defeat. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things out there. Could it have been something... that crawled out of your lab? Something that- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's... not possible. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then something got on board. Some kind of life form. Something that- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or something that was already on board, with us in the hyper-bunks. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean? NADIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it could have been the accelerator. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only theory I can come up with. The synthetic enzyme in our feeding tubes. The accelerator that would help our bodies adjust and adapt to the environmental conditions on Tanis. From what I've seen... these things have adapted... to the ship instead. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, why would- You're saying we'll become like them? Why would they be affected like that and we're not- NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Like I said, it's the only theory I can think of- Unless... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLO'S gaze is hollow and translucent as he stares throu the glass porthole in the empty sleep chamber, his mind i deeply pondering. Pupils dilated. ANGLE ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLO is looking at the empty sleep chambers while PAYTON remains at the control console, determined not to give up contacting BOWER. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the symptoms of Pandorum? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orbital Dysfunctional Syndrome. Pandorum. Ever witnessed the symptoms of first-hand? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen it before. But nothing that- GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not something you can easily detect. Starts with a shiver. An itch. A slow boil... and without being able to get off the ship... there's no shutting off the heat. It'll boil over, no matter what you do. GALLO is slowly pacing the room and PAYTON watches him wi uneasiness out of the corner of his eye. GALLO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that- GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could they both have had it? The odds are insurmountable. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't about to question any of your ACTIONS- (CONTINUED)
I CONTINUED: GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, we all know Pandorum is greatly affected by any substantial psychological It has an emotional trigger effect. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off his look) That's what they say. GALLO slowly rubs his temples, with hesitation. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think you would react... if you knew the truth? PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth... about what? DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LELAND flips on dim flood lights, illuminating the upper walls of the tank where... like ancient cave-drawings, a I story has been crudely sketched out along the wall of t tank. LELAND lurks through the shadows, telling the tale with a campfire, spook story, flare of dramatics. LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B0000OM! Oh, how the world cheered to the thunder of it's mightiest creation. Eylisium! The heaven for heroes, to venture further and farther then any of man's machine dared before it. BOWER and NADIA watch intently as TANAKA lazily sips the soup. The first image is off the ship's launch and LELAND hobbles across to the crudely sketched image of three figures, flight officers. LELAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three of our bravest... atop the watch tower as we slept. A slumber deeper then any have dared... with only three little Indians left to mind the store... DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLO slowly unravels his own tale as PAYTON watches on w suspicion and caution. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we were only into our second term. All flight systems nominal. I'd picked up on symptoms with my CO and 2nd Lieutenant. Mild symptoms. Nothing I thought would... become a problem. Until we got the transmission. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What transmission? GALLO'S eyes are welling up, his lip begins to shiver. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final transmission. The last message... from home. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LELAND continues across his wall-drawings, the three pilo pictured, receiving a radio call. I LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .until the last cry from home. All of God's creation... ending with mere words of encouragement. Mother Earth's last call. Boop! Leave a message, momma. LELAND presses a switch on a Jerry-rigged piece of equipm a disc player... speakers crackling with static. A VOICE plays, heavily distorted. RECORDER VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoove arr awl dadz efft ah uz. Bood uck, boogz guezz... ab hoobz deeb. BOWER and NADIA are now completely engrossed in the story both getting to their feet and walking closer to hear. TANAKA is asleep. LELAND is thrilled by their attention, doing a dance as he plays the recording... over and over.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDER VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hoove err all wadz efft ah uz. Good wuck, boogz guezz... abb hoobz deeb... BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that... saying? LELAND cranks a power lever, speeding up the play back wi eagerness, whispering along. The recording slowly grows l distorted the more he cranks the lever. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: RECORDER VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoove are all watt efft of uz. Good uck, gog besh... ab Gogz deez. You are all whadz left of uz. Gog besh... and Gogs sbeeb... God blezz... and Gogz speeb... Slowly LELAND'S whisper and the recording come into uniso eerily echoing through the tank. LELAND & RECORDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are all that's left of us. Good luck, God bless... and God's speed. LELAND and the recorder echo throughout the tank as... DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLO matches the echo with... GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are that's left of us. Good luck, God bless... and God's speed. E PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth... is gone? GALLO puffs across his hand with twisted amusement. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wiped away. We ran a full sweep off the grid and they were... gone. One day there, the next... nothing. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one day... it had to be nuclear or-? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it was, they knew it was coming. Wished us well. We're all that's left. PAYTON sits back in shock, shaking his head in disbelief. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see why I was hesitant... to tell even you. My fellow crew members didn't take the news too well. I wanted to wake the primary crew... but my 2nd Lt was already over the edge. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED : GALLO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ODS came through with flying colors. No logic, no reasoning left. No future, no past, no hope. A dangerous mix when you're stuck inside a tin can like this. The blow was more then he could handle. My lieutenant wasn't far behind. Pandorum. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LELAND moves past a wall-drawing of Earth destroyed, movi to the image of the three pilots. LELAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three little Indians, with the burden to bare... no more law and nothing left to care. Three poor souls, destiny undone. Chop, chop, chop... now there's only one. The sketches reveal violence between the three pilots, tw them killed, one remaining alive. I DISSOLVE TO: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLO'S hands are beginning to tremble as he struggles through the story. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were my commanding officers. Men who had guided me through FT. I looked up to these men. But... it wasn't them anymore. They... were gone. They... tried to... I had no choice. I- With his body beginning to tremble, PAYTON tries to conso him, touching his arm. GALLO flinches. PAYTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy... DISSOLVE TO:

It appears undisturbed, a thin layer of silt floats out from under t footsteps. BOWER leads the way, panning the weapon throughout the ro with no sign of GALLO. On the far wall; cockpit windows coated with a black fungus that obscures the view, but hi to the illusion of outer space, a haze of cosmic dust wit stars. NADIA (IN AWE)

dialogues.text: What's happened... to us? Where are we? BOWER goes to the nearest control console, tapping the keyboard. The computer instantly responds, data scrolling across the screen. BOWER

dialogues.text: Flight log. It'll tell us how long we've I been out... and how far we've gone. BOWER types in a command and the computer begins to scrol through the flight computer's time-code. Starting with th launch date and time the numbers begin to roll faster and faster. BLIP... BLIP... BLIP. (CONTINUED)

BOWER approaches from behind GALLO... his identification tatto now clearly visible... FLT>>004>>012&gt lever on the gun with a WHINE of magnetos and the laser sights flare brightly onto GALLO'S back. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Seems my little memory lapse has finally worn off... "Lieutenant". BOWER slowly approaches, moving closer to his profile, th stream of blood from GALLO'S ear shown running down his n GALLO (DRYLY)

dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? GALLO keeps his gaze towards the windows, emotionless. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: You're team four. Why would you... switch bunks? Pretend to be someone else? What would you be wanting to hide? Who the hell are you? GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the one... who first received the final transmission. Who refused to go back to sleep. You stayed awake... for all those years. What were you doing... what crimes were you hiding from when you took Payton's bunk? The time-code display rolls faster, years rolling into decades... BLIP, BLIP, BLIP. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) GALLO (IMPRESSED)

dialogues.text: How the hell would you know all that? BOWER

He stays with the weapon on GALLO as NADIA wanders toward th front control console, towards the glass. With the lights fading on the weapon, BOWER gives the lev quick whirl, motioning the barrel closer.

dialogues.speaker: GALLO, (CONT ' D)
dialogues.text: What are. you gonna do, Bower? There's no one left to hand out merit badges. No one left at all. BOWER

dialogues.text: Judgement will come for you. You think you could cover it? Your victims survived. Evolved. That's your creation out there. Your crime. BOWER jabs the gun into his back with force. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you thought you'd be able to hide it? Who would ever suspect that? Who would ever remember? I remember. NADIA rubs the glass with her hand, squinting into the darkness. The time-code display rolls faster, decades int centuries... BLIP, BLIP, BLIP. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (3) GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No world left. No law. No order. Only us. You the law now? You gonna be the one that brings order to what's left? Wanna take a shot at it? I did my best with what I was given. Wanna be King for a day? Give it a whirl, Corporal. I'd like to see how you fare. With the laser sights fading on the weapon, BOWER quickly cranks the power lever, keeping the gun raised- A slow grin spreads across GALLO'S face as he finally loo to him, revealing the thick streams of blood that have dripped from his nose, coating his chin and neck.

dialogues.speaker: GALLO
dialogues.text: Try to imagine it. Imagine... yourself for five minutes without morality. I'll bet you'd surprise even yourself, kid- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up. (TO NADIA)

dialogues.text: What's out there? NADIA shakes her head, rubbing away the sludge from the glass, squinting harder. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine... us both. What's left to stop you? I offer you the kingdom and you- BOWER SHUT-UP- GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still quite a few sleeping beauties down there... a thousand flavors. You up for a little window shopping? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up! GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (licking his lips) I wanna see it. I'll bet you'd be a REEEEAL TIGER-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER suddenly shoves him out of the chair, slamming him the floor, jabbing the barrel into the back of his neck. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (4) BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be law... in whatever world we create. And you'll pay for what you've done. Believe me. GALLO chuckles with his face pressed to the floor. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real boy scout, is that it, kiddo? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: HEAR ME ASSHOLE
dialogues.text: NADIA suddenly GASPS... flinching away from the cockpit windows, having just seen what's outside. Her expression ghostly as she back pedals. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? GALLO looks up with a blood-soaked grin. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see!? I GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready for the new world, corporal? BOWER keeps the gun on him as he goes to the windows. NAD has a ghostly expression, unable to speak. BOWER leans toward the glass, squinting into the darkness and... SWISH! An object moves past the outside of the glass. He leans closer, squinting to see... a school of ALIEN FISH past. The shin is underwater. BOWER staggers in shock, back pedalling as GALLO continue chuckle. BOWER (DISBELIEF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've... we've already crashed. We've already... we're... The time-code display rolls centuries past, more then a thousand years accounted for as it finally slows to a sto BLIP... BLIP... BLIP. BOWER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been... down here... all this time!? All this... time- (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (5)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER staggers against the console in shock,. the weapon lowering to his side. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this thing does land itself. Just doesn't float too well. BOWER lunges towards him and GALLO is ready for this one, quickly countering his move and SLAMMING BOWER into the console. He unleashes a vicious BLOW into BOWER'S throat. BOWER collapses, choking for air and GALLO kicks the gun away. He kneels over BOWER, slowly pulling out a blade.

dialogues.speaker: G_ALLO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you thought you could be King!? He slides the blade under BOWER'S neck and... there's a W of magnetos. He looks up to see NADIA cranking the lever on the energy gun. She tries to turn the gun towards him and... I

dialogues.text: GALLO lunges toward her just as she's able to FIRE! The BLA..ST of energy goes into the console with a CRACK of 1 THUNDER, knocking everyone off their feet. Shattered gl and metal HIT the cockpit window like a spray of shrapnel CLOSE UP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .sending a thin crack across the surface of the glass. She struggles to crank the lever again as GALLO charges, hitting the gun away. He SLAMS her over the console. GALLO (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: My apologies. Ladies first... of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crack on the window begins to spiderweb across... ANGLE ON

dialogues.text: GALLO grabs her hair to expose her neck and angles the bl upward, forcing her to take a GASP as... BOSSSH! Water explodes through the windows, hitting the r like a hundred fire hoses. GALLO is hit directly and thro across the room as NADIA and BOWER are engulfed by the bl of black water, sent tumbling. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: The tremendous ROAR of rushing water rolls them down the stairwell and into the sleep chamber compartment in a rag torrent, a tidal wave slams into the wall. BOWER grabs onto NADIA and they claw themselves along the wall as computer terminals SPARK and LIGHTS go black. He pulls her to a sleep-chamber and he jumps inside the open hatch, pulling her with. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!? Are you crazy- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: GET IN
dialogues.text: He pulls her inside and turns to the control panel. He hi the keypad to read: >>> DETACHMENT INITIATED &gt BOWER struggles to close the hatch as water rushes in, SLAMMING it shut on top of them. GALLO struggles to keep his head above water as the fast moving current SLAMS him into the edge of the doorway. Hi I fingers claw at the manual lever for the door, tugging tugging with no effect as the water rises above his head. CUT TO:

dialogues.text: BOWER and NADIA are squeezed together inside the pod as w quickly rises above the porthole. NADIA (GASPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like this! I can't- like this! BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on! Under the roar of the rushing water, hydraulics ignite. Micro-jets FIRE and WHOOSH! The pod launches, shooting do a tunnel until they're HIT with a tremendous JOLT. They are sent spinning into a wild tumble as bubbles and erupt across the outer surface. BOWER and NADIA slam into one another as the chamber turns end over end. Its roll seems to slow for a brief moment and BOWER squin toward the porthole to see... (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: POV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are pulling away from the side of the ship. The exterior hull of the massive space ship slides past at a rate of speed with a swirl of ocean water and bubbles. BAM! The pod SLAMS into something as SPARKS fly and seals are ruptured as WATER sprays in with a blinding BLAST. Th chamber is sent into another violent roll as NADIA and BO tumble head over feet, as if caught within a washing mach The chamber finally steadies as water washes across the control panel, one last burst of sparks knocks out the lights, taking them into BLACK. Only their gasps are heard as they squirm towards the upp corner... only a foot of air remaining. He grabs the mask connected to tubes in the side and pull the straps over her head. NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I What are you doing!? BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 Put it on! NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I can't- Not like this! I'm not going to wake up and drowned- BOWER

dialogues.speaker: PUT IT ON
dialogues.text: He pulls it over her face as the water rises with only several inches of air inside the chamber. BOWER gasps desperately into the corner. NADIA gasps the air through the mask, making her eye-lids droop, slowly going unconscious. BOWER gasps one last bre and the water rises over his head. BOWER watches her body go limp and squirms for air as... warm GLOW of WHITE LIGHT grows brighter through the porth As sunlight dances through the porthole, he kicks at the hatch and... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOWER kicks open the hatch, gasping for breath. A gentle breeze ripples across the water with a sunlight flickerin across the surface of an ocean. He pulls NADIA out of the chamber, ripping the mask off h face. Her eye-lids slowly begin to flicker back to consciousness. BOWER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...? Hey? She chokes on the air and struggles to orientate herself, looking up to see him gazing down at her, coated with bri sunlight. NADIA (GASPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we? What happened? BOWER (GRIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. It's safe to wake up this time. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With eyes of disbelief, they turn to see... WIDE ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit on the edge of the sleep chamber as it lightly b within the ocean waves. They're just off shore from a stretch of mountainous tropical islands with waves crashi against the beaches. The unusual shape of the islands and their geography are nothing like we've ever seen on Earth Several moons dot the sky and the sun is rising with a brilliant glow on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. A low CHURNING is heard, a motor that is pumping as the water lowers, allowing us to see across th dishevelled command platform, the walls dripping with wat The water is being drained through the grates in the floo unseen bilge pumps are heard loudly WHIRLING. The pump motors whine down and shut off as... CONTROL CONSOLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand flips off the switch for the ventilation ducts. It GALLO... (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing at the console, having changed clothes and recov from the ordeal. He examines the empty tank where BOWER'S sleep chamber once sat. He eyes the other sleep-chambers, deeply contemplating. He goes back to the control console, scanning across the numerous surveillance monitors that reveal... PASSENGERS and HUNTERS engaged in a variety of activities across the ship. Some are seen fighting, some searching f food, some searching for a way out, some alone weeping. A kingdom, for the taking. He pulls out a coffee packet and slowly begins mixing him a cup, deeply contemplating as he looks across the screen He glances over to see... YOUNG GALLO, the younger versio himself, who is seated nearby, watching with a grin. The blood is gone from his face, appearing clean-cut, clean uniform. YOUNG GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you're gonna be captain... what are we gonna do now? Off his look... CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUSH... THUD. Doors open to another sleep chamber compartment, completely undisturbed. Four undisturbed sle chambers are lined against the wall. GALLO enters, now wearing the CAPTAIN'S uniform, he straightens his collar and kneels next to one of the pods typing into the panel. A grin appears as he removes the wedding ring (PAYTON'S ring) he'd forgotten he's still wearing. GALLO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is a King... without his Queen. He hits the control panel switch and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FEMALE CREW MEMBER, a beautiful young woman, deep in hy slumber suddenly twitches... her EYES opening wide with a GASP as she stares into CAMERA. CUT TO BLACK. THE END
